project: Onboarding Phase 7 - Player Dashboard & Graduation Flow
description: LOW PRIORITY: Basic player dashboard and 18th birthday graduation flow. Allows players who turn 18 to claim their own account, transitioning from guardian-managed to self-managed.

userStories.title: Add claim fields to playerIdentities schema
userStories.description: As the system, I track when a player has claimed their account.
acceptanceCriteria: Find the playerIdentities table (or orgPlayerEnrollments if using that)
userId: v.optional(v.string()),           // Set when player claims account
claimInvitedBy: v.optional(v.string()),   // Guardian userId who initiated
userStories.notes: Once userId is set, the player can access their own data directly.

userStories.title: Create playerGraduations table for tracking
userStories.description: As the system, I track players who have turned 18 and their graduation status.
userStories.notes: This table tracks the graduation lifecycle for each player.

userStories.title: Create playerClaimTokens table
userStories.description: As the system, I generate secure tokens for players to claim their accounts.
userStories.notes: Tokens expire after 30 days. Once used, usedAt is set.

userStories.title: Create birthday detection scheduled job
userStories.description: As the system, I detect players who have turned 18 and create graduation records.
acceptanceCriteria: - Query players where dateOfBirth <= 18 years ago AND no graduation record exists
- For each, create playerGraduations record with status = 'pending'
// Check if graduation record already exists
userStories.notes: Job runs daily at 6 AM UTC. Uses 365.25 to account for leap years.

userStories.title: Create guardian prompt for pending graduations
userStories.description: As a guardian with a child who turned 18, I see a prompt to send them an account claim invitation.
acceptanceCriteria: Args: none (uses authenticated user as guardian)
Returns: v.array(v.object({ playerName, dateOfBirth, turnedEighteenAt, playerIdentityId }))
Logic: Get guardian's linked children → Filter for those with pending graduation records
- Text: 'They can now have their own account to view their development history.'
- Input: Email address for the player
- Button: 'Send Invitation' → Creates claim token, sends email
- Button: 'Not Now' (secondary) → Dismisses for now, shows again next login
- Button: 'Don't Ask Again' (tertiary, text) → Marks as dismissed permanently
- Check for pending graduations after other steps
userStories.notes: This is a softer prompt than GDPR - can be dismissed temporarily or permanently.

userStories.title: Create sendGraduationInvite mutation
userStories.description: As a guardian, I can send an account claim invitation to my child who turned 18.
acceptanceCriteria: Returns: v.object({ success: v.boolean(), token: v.optional(v.string()) })
1. Verify current user is a guardian of this player
2. Verify graduation record exists and status = 'pending'
3. Generate secure token (use crypto.randomUUID or similar)
userStories.notes: Email sending requires action. Token should be cryptographically secure.

userStories.title: Create dismissGraduationPrompt mutation
userStories.description: As a guardian, I can dismiss the graduation prompt permanently.
acceptanceCriteria: 1. Verify current user is a guardian of this player
userStories.notes: Dismissed means guardian chose not to send invitation. Player can still be invited later by admin.

userStories.title: Create claim account page and wizard
userStories.description: As a player receiving a claim invitation, I can claim my account through a wizard.
acceptanceCriteria: If invalid/expired/used: Show error message with appropriate action
1. Welcome: 'Hi {playerName}! Claim your account to access your development history'
2. Account: Sign up or sign in (if already have account)
4. Review: Show player profile summary, confirm
userStories.notes: If player already has an account, they sign in. Otherwise, they create one.

userStories.title: Create claimPlayerAccount mutation
userStories.description: As a player completing the claim wizard, I finalize claiming my account.
acceptanceCriteria: Returns: v.object({ success: v.boolean(), playerIdentityId: v.optional(v.id('playerIdentities')) })
1. Verify token is valid and not expired or used
6. Create notification for guardian: '{playerName} has claimed their account'
userStories.notes: After claiming, player has direct access to their data via userId link.

userStories.title: Create basic player dashboard page
userStories.description: As a player who has claimed their account, I have a dashboard to view my information.
acceptanceCriteria: Page requires: User has a claimed playerIdentity in this org
Returns: Player info, teams, development goals, recent assessments
- Profile card: Photo, name, age group, position
- Development goals: Progress on assigned goals
- Recent activity: Latest coach notes, assessments
Keep it read-only for MVP. Players view, not edit.
userStories.notes: This is a basic dashboard. Enhanced player features can be added later.

userStories.title: Add player dashboard link to navigation
userStories.description: As a player, I see a link to my dashboard in the navigation.
acceptanceCriteria: Logic: Check if user has a claimed playerIdentity in this org
userStories.notes: Only show link if user is a claimed player in this org. Most users won't see this.

verificationSteps: Test: Create player with DOB 18+ years ago → Run birthday job → Graduation record created
Test: Guardian logs in → Sees prompt for 18-year-old → Sends invitation
Test: Player clicks claim link → Completes wizard → Account claimed
Test: Player logs in → Sees player dashboard with their info
successCriteria: Birthday detection job identifies players turning 18
Guardian sees prompt for eligible children
Claim wizard works (welcome, account, GDPR, confirm)
Player account is linked after claiming
Guardian receives notification when player claims
